title: Overview of work designated by the Minister [R205(c)(ii) – C16, C41, C42, C43, C44, C45, C46, C47, C48, C49, C52, C88] – Canadian interest – International Mobility Program

text:
Published Time: Wed, 11 Feb 2026 21:09:07 GMT

Overview of work designated by the Minister [R205(c)(ii) – C16, C41, C42, C43, C44, C45, C46, C47, C48, C49, C52, C88] – Canadian interest – International Mobility Program
===========================================================================================================================================================================

This section contains policy, procedures and guidance used by IRCC staff. It is posted on the department’s website as a courtesy to stakeholders.

The Minister has designated the following categories as necessary for public policy reasons related to the competitiveness of Canada’s academic institutions or economy under [subparagraph 205(c)(ii) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations (IRPR)](https://laws-lois.justice.gc.ca/eng/regulations/SOR-2002-227/section-205.html).

In this section
---------------

* [Francophone mobility – [R205(c) - C16] – Canadian interests – International Mobility Program](https://www.canada.ca/en/immigration-refugees-citizenship/corporate/publications-manuals/operational-bulletins-manuals/temporary-residents/foreign-workers/exemption-codes/canadian-interests-significant-benefit-mobilite-francophone-r205-exemption-code-c16.html)
* Family members of foreign workers

[Family members of foreign nationals authorized to work in high-skilled occupations (TEER 0, 1, 2 or 3) – [C41 and C46]](https://www.canada.ca/en/immigration-refugees-citizenship/corporate/publications-manuals/operational-bulletins-manuals/temporary-residents/foreign-workers/public-policy-competitiveness-economy/c41-c46.html)* for applications received before January 21, 2025, from family members of high-skilled workers
 * for applications received on or after January 21, 2025, from family members of certain high-skilled workers who are transitioning to permanent residence, but the application for permanent residence has not been submitted as yet
 * **for in-Canada applicants only:** applications received on or after January 21, 2025, from family members of workers applying for a work permit renewal with a requested duration that aligns with the principal foreign national’s existing work authorization
[Spouses or common-law partners of foreign nationals authorized to work in high-skilled occupations TEER 0 or 1, or select occupations TEER 2 or 3) – [C41]](https://www.canada.ca/en/immigration-refugees-citizenship/corporate/publications-manuals/operational-bulletins-manuals/temporary-residents/foreign-workers/exemption-codes/public-policy-competitiveness-economy/spouses-common-law-authorized-work-high-skilled-occupations.html)* for applications received on or after January 21, 2025
[Family members of foreign nationals authorized to work in low skilled occupations (TEER 4 or 5) – [C47 and C48]](https://www.canada.ca/en/immigration-refugees-citizenship/corporate/publications-manuals/operational-bulletins-manuals/temporary-residents/foreign-workers/public-policy-competitiveness-economy/c47-c48.html)* for applications received before January 21, 2025, from family members of low-skilled workers
 * for applications received on or after January 21, 2025, from family members of certain low-skilled workers who are transitioning to permanent residence but no application for permanent residence has been submitted as yet
 * **For in-Canada applicants only:** applications received on or after January 21, 2025, from family members of workers applying for a work permit renewal with a requested duration that aligns with the principal foreign national’s existing work authorization
[Family members of work permit holders who are Economic Class permanent resident applicants or were nominated or selected by a province – [C49]](https://www.canada.ca/en/immigration-refugees-citizenship/corporate/publications-manuals/operational-bulletins-manuals/temporary-residents/foreign-workers/public-policy-competitiveness-economy/c49.html)* For applications received prior to January 21, 2025, or after that date

* [Spouses and common-law partners of study permit holders – [C42]](https://www.canada.ca/en/immigration-refugees-citizenship/corporate/publications-manuals/operational-bulletins-manuals/temporary-residents/foreign-workers/public-policy-competitiveness-economy/c42.html)
* [Post-graduation work permit (PGWP) – [C43]](https://www.canada.ca/en/immigration-refugees-citizenship/corporate/publications-manuals/operational-bulletins-manuals/temporary-residents/study-permits/post-graduation-work-permit-program.html)
* [Post-doctoral fellows awarded a Doctor of Philosophy (PhD) – [C44]](https://www.canada.ca/en/immigration-refugees-citizenship/corporate/publications-manuals/operational-bulletins-manuals/temporary-residents/foreign-workers/public-policy-competitiveness-economy/c44.html)
* [Foreign medical (or dental) residents and medical research fellows - [C45]](https://www.canada.ca/en/immigration-refugees-citizenship/corporate/publications-manuals/operational-bulletins-manuals/temporary-residents/foreign-workers/public-policy-competitiveness-economy/c45.html)
 * [Medical residents](https://www.canada.ca/en/immigration-refugees-citizenship/corporate/publications-manuals/operational-bulletins-manuals/temporary-residents/foreign-workers/public-policy-competitiveness-economy/c45.html#medical-residents)
 * [Medical fellowship holders](https://www.canada.ca/en/immigration-refugees-citizenship/corporate/publications-manuals/operational-bulletins-manuals/temporary-residents/foreign-workers/public-policy-competitiveness-economy/c45.html#medical-fellowship)

* [Academic Award recipients for research work - [C52]](https://www.canada.ca/en/immigration-refugees-citizenship/corporate/publications-manuals/operational-bulletins-manuals/temporary-residents/foreign-workers/public-policy-competitiveness-economy/c52.html)
 * [Award recipients funded by Canadian institutions](https://www.canada.ca/en/immigration-refugees-citizenship/corporate/publications-manuals/operational-bulletins-manuals/temporary-residents/foreign-workers/public-policy-competitiveness-economy/c52.html#award)
 * [Award recipients funded by foreign institutions](https://www.canada.ca/en/immigration-refugees-citizenship/corporate/publications-manuals/operational-bulletins-manuals/temporary-residents/foreign-workers/public-policy-competitiveness-economy/c52.html#award-1)

* [Innovation Stream pilot – Issuance of an LMIA-exempt employer-specific work permit for foreign nationals destined to work for a Global Hypergrowth Project (GHP) employer – [C88]](https://www.canada.ca/en/immigration-refugees-citizenship/corporate/publications-manuals/operational-bulletins-manuals/temporary-residents/foreign-workers/public-policy-competitiveness-economy/innovation-stream-pilot.html)

Page details
------------

 2025-02-03
